content.text:
<file path="server/src/handlers/get_counter.ts">
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type Counter } from '../schema';

export const getCounter = async (): Promise<Counter> => {
  try {
    // Try to get existing counter
    const existingCounters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .limit(1)
      .execute();

    if (existingCounters.length > 0) {
      return existingCounters[0];
    }

    // No counter exists, create one with default value 0
    const result = await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values({
        value: 0
      })
      .returning()
      .execute();

    return result[0];
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Get counter failed:', error);
    throw error;
  }
};
</file>

<file path="server/src/tests/get_counter.test.ts">
import { afterEach, beforeEach, describe, expect, it } from 'bun:test';
import { resetDB, createDB } from '../helpers';
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { getCounter } from '../handlers/get_counter';

describe('getCounter', () => {
  beforeEach(createDB);
  afterEach(resetDB);

  it('should create and return a counter with value 0 when none exists', async () => {
    const result = await getCounter();

    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.value).toEqual(0);
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should return existing counter if one exists', async () => {
    // Create a counter first
    await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values({ value: 42 })
      .execute();

    const result = await getCounter();

    expect(result.value).toEqual(42);
    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should save counter to database when creating new one', async () => {
    await getCounter();

    // Verify it was saved to database
    const counters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .execute();

    expect(counters).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(counters[0].value).toEqual(0);
    expect(counters[0].updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should return the first counter when multiple exist', async () => {
    // Create multiple counters
    await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values([
        { value: 10 },
        { value: 20 }
      ])
      .execute();

    const result = await getCounter();

    // Should return one of the counters (first one due to limit(1))
    expect([10, 20]).toContain(result.value);
    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });
});
</file>

<file path="server/src/handlers/increment_counter.ts">
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type IncrementCounterInput, type Counter } from '../schema';
import { eq, sql } from 'drizzle-orm';

export async function incrementCounter(input: IncrementCounterInput): Promise<Counter> {
  try {
    // First, check if a counter exists (assuming we work with counter id=1 as default)
    const existingCounters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .where(eq(countersTable.id, 1))
      .execute();

    let result;
    
    if (existingCounters.length === 0) {
      // No counter exists, create one with the increment value
      const insertResult = await db.insert(countersTable)
        .values({
          value: input.increment,
          updated_at: new Date()
        })
        .returning()
        .execute();
      
      result = insertResult[0];
    } else {
      // Counter exists, increment its value
      const updateResult = await db.update(countersTable)
        .set({
          value: sql`${countersTable.value} + ${input.increment}`,
          updated_at: new Date()
        })
        .where(eq(countersTable.id, 1))
        .returning()
        .execute();
      
      result = updateResult[0];
    }

    return result;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Counter increment failed:', error);
    throw error;
  }
}
</file>

<file path="server/src/tests/increment_counter.test.ts">
import { afterEach, beforeEach, describe, expect, it } from 'bun:test';
import { resetDB, createDB } from '../helpers';
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type IncrementCounterInput } from '../schema';
import { incrementCounter } from '../handlers/increment_counter';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('incrementCounter', () => {
  beforeEach(createDB);
  afterEach(resetDB);

  it('should create a new counter when none exists', async () => {
    const input: IncrementCounterInput = { increment: 5 };
    
    const result = await incrementCounter(input);

    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.value).toEqual(5);
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should increment existing counter value', async () => {
    // Create initial counter
    await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values({ value: 10 })
      .execute();

    const input: IncrementCounterInput = { increment: 3 };
    
    const result = await incrementCounter(input);

    expect(result.value).toEqual(13);
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should use default increment value of 1', async () => {
    const input: IncrementCounterInput = {}; // No increment specified, should default to 1
    
    const result = await incrementCounter(input);

    expect(result.value).toEqual(1);
  });

  it('should save counter to database', async () => {
    const input: IncrementCounterInput = { increment: 7 };
    
    const result = await incrementCounter(input);

    // Verify in database
    const counters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .where(eq(countersTable.id, result.id))
      .execute();

    expect(counters).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(counters[0].value).toEqual(7);
    expect(counters[0].updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should handle multiple increments correctly', async () => {
    // First increment
    await incrementCounter({ increment: 5 });
    
    // Second increment
    const result = await incrementCounter({ increment: 3 });

    expect(result.value).toEqual(8);
  });

  it('should update timestamp on each increment', async () => {
    // Create initial counter
    const first = await incrementCounter({ increment: 1 });
    
    // Wait a small amount to ensure different timestamp
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 10));
    
    // Increment again
    const second = await incrementCounter({ increment: 1 });

    expect(second.updated_at.getTime()).toBeGreaterThan(first.updated_at.getTime());
    expect(second.value).toEqual(2);
  });
});
</file>

});

<file path="server/src/handlers/reset_counter.ts">
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type ResetCounterInput, type CounterWithMessage } from '../schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

export async function resetCounter(input: ResetCounterInput): Promise<CounterWithMessage> {
  try {
    const counterId = input.id || 1; // Default to counter ID 1
    
    // Check if counter exists, create if it doesn't
    const existingCounters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .where(eq(countersTable.id, counterId))
      .execute();

    let counter;
    if (existingCounters.length === 0) {
      // Create new counter with count 0
      const result = await db.insert(countersTable)
        .values({
          count: 0
        })
        .returning()
        .execute();
      counter = result[0];
    } else {
      // Update existing counter to 0
      const result = await db.update(countersTable)
        .set({
          count: 0,
          updated_at: new Date()
        })
        .where(eq(countersTable.id, counterId))
        .returning()
        .execute();
      counter = result[0];
    }

    // Generate fun message for reset counter
    const message = "🎯 Counter reset! Ready for a fresh start! 🚀";
    
    return {
      id: counter.id,
      count: counter.count,
      message: message,
      created_at: counter.created_at,
      updated_at: counter.updated_at
    };
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Counter reset failed:', error);
    throw error;
  }
}
</file>

<file path="server/src/tests/reset_counter.test.ts">
import { afterEach, beforeEach, describe, expect, it } from 'bun:test';
import { resetDB, createDB } from '../helpers';
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type ResetCounterInput } from '../schema';
import { resetCounter } from '../handlers/reset_counter';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('resetCounter', () => {
  beforeEach(createDB);
  afterEach(resetDB);

  it('should reset counter to 0 with fun message', async () => {
    // First create a counter with some count
    const initialCounter = await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values({ count: 42 })
      .returning()
      .execute();

    const testInput: ResetCounterInput = {
      id: initialCounter[0].id
    };

    const result = await resetCounter(testInput);

    // Verify counter was reset
    expect(result.id).toEqual(initialCounter[0].id);
    expect(result.count).toEqual(0);
    expect(result.message).toEqual("🎯 Counter reset! Ready for a fresh start! 🚀");
    expect(result.created_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should save reset counter to database', async () => {
    // Create initial counter
    const initialCounter = await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values({ count: 15 })
      .returning()
      .execute();

    const testInput: ResetCounterInput = {
      id: initialCounter[0].id
    };

    const result = await resetCounter(testInput);

    // Verify database was updated
    const counters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .where(eq(countersTable.id, result.id))
      .execute();

    expect(counters).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(counters[0].count).toEqual(0);
    expect(counters[0].updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should create new counter if id does not exist', async () => {
    const testInput: ResetCounterInput = {
      id: 999 // Non-existent ID
    };

    const result = await resetCounter(testInput);

    // Verify new counter was created
    expect(result.count).toEqual(0);
    expect(result.message).toEqual("🎯 Counter reset! Ready for a fresh start! 🚀");
    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.created_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Verify it exists in database
    const counters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .where(eq(countersTable.id, result.id))
      .execute();

    expect(counters).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(counters[0].count).toEqual(0);
  });

  it('should use default counter ID when not provided', async () => {
    const testInput: ResetCounterInput = {}; // No ID provided

    const result = await resetCounter(testInput);

    // Should create counter with default behavior
    expect(result.count).toEqual(0);
    expect(result.message).toEqual("🎯 Counter reset! Ready for a fresh start! 🚀");
    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.created_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should update existing counter timestamps correctly', async () => {
    // Create initial counter
    const initialCounter = await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values({ count: 25 })
      .returning()
      .execute();

    // Wait a small amount to ensure timestamp difference
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 10));

    const testInput: ResetCounterInput = {
      id: initialCounter[0].id
    };

    const result = await resetCounter(testInput);

    // Verify timestamps
    expect(result.created_at).toEqual(initialCounter[0].created_at);
    expect(result.updated_at.getTime()).toBeGreaterThan(initialCounter[0].updated_at.getTime());
  });
});
</file>

<file path="server/src/handlers/increment_counter.ts">
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type IncrementCounterInput, type CounterWithMessage } from '../schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

export async function incrementCounter(input: IncrementCounterInput): Promise<CounterWithMessage> {
    try {
        const counterId = input.id || 1; // Default to counter ID 1
        
        // First, try to get existing counter
        const existingCounters = await db.select()
            .from(countersTable)
            .where(eq(countersTable.id, counterId))
            .execute();
        
        let counter;
        
        if (existingCounters.length === 0) {
            // Create new counter with count = 1
            const newCounters = await db.insert(countersTable)
                .values({
                    count: 1
                })
                .returning()
                .execute();
            counter = newCounters[0];
        } else {
            // Increment existing counter
            const updatedCounters = await db.update(countersTable)
                .set({
                    count: existingCounters[0].count + 1,
                    updated_at: new Date()
                })
                .where(eq(countersTable.id, counterId))
                .returning()
                .execute();
            counter = updatedCounters[0];
        }
        
        // Generate fun message with emojis based on new count
        const message = generateFunMessage(counter.count);
        
        return {
            id: counter.id,
            count: counter.count,
            message: message,
            created_at: counter.created_at,
            updated_at: counter.updated_at
        };
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Counter increment failed:', error);
        throw error;
    }
}

function generateFunMessage(count: number): string {
    // Generate different messages based on count milestones
    if (count === 0) {
        return "🎯 Ready to start counting? Let's go! 🚀";
    } else if (count === 1) {
        return "🎉 First click! You're on your way! ✨";
    } else if (count < 5) {
        return `🌟 You've clicked ${count} times! Keep going! 💪`;
    } else if (count < 10) {
        return `🔥 ${count} clicks and counting! You're on fire! 🚀`;
    } else if (count < 25) {
        return `🎊 Wow! ${count} clicks! You're unstoppable! 💫`;
    } else if (count < 50) {
        return `🏆 Amazing! ${count} clicks! You're a clicking champion! 🎯`;
    } else if (count < 100) {
        return `🚀 Incredible! ${count} clicks! You're reaching for the stars! ⭐`;
    } else if (count < 500) {
        return `🎉 Phenomenal! ${count} clicks! You're a clicking legend! 👑`;
    } else if (count < 1000) {
        return `💎 Outstanding! ${count} clicks! You're absolutely brilliant! ✨`;
    } else {
        return `🌟 LEGENDARY! ${count} clicks! You've achieved greatness! 🏆👑🎊`;
    }
}
</file>

<file path="server/src/tests/increment_counter.test.ts">
import { afterEach, beforeEach, describe, expect, it } from 'bun:test';
import { resetDB, createDB } from '../helpers';
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type IncrementCounterInput } from '../schema';
import { incrementCounter } from '../handlers/increment_counter';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('incrementCounter', () => {
    beforeEach(createDB);
    afterEach(resetDB);

    it('should create new counter with count 1 when no counter exists', async () => {
        const input: IncrementCounterInput = { id: 1 };
        
        const result = await incrementCounter(input);
        
        expect(result.id).toBe(1);
        expect(result.count).toBe(1);
        expect(result.message).toBe("🎉 First click! You're on your way! ✨");
        expect(result.created_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
        expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    });

    it('should increment existing counter', async () => {
        // Create initial counter
        await db.insert(countersTable)
            .values({ count: 5 })
            .execute();
        
        const input: IncrementCounterInput = { id: 1 };
        
        const result = await incrementCounter(input);
        
        expect(result.id).toBe(1);
        expect(result.count).toBe(6);
        expect(result.message).toBe("🔥 6 clicks and counting! You're on fire! 🚀");
        expect(result.created_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
        expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    });

    it('should use default counter id when not provided', async () => {
        const input: IncrementCounterInput = {};
        
        const result = await incrementCounter(input);
        
        expect(result.id).toBe(1);
        expect(result.count).toBe(1);
        expect(result.message).toBe("🎉 First click! You're on your way! ✨");
    });

    it('should save incremented counter to database', async () => {
        // Create initial counter
        await db.insert(countersTable)
            .values({ count: 10 })
            .execute();
        
        const input: IncrementCounterInput = { id: 1 };
        
        await incrementCounter(input);
        
        // Verify database was updated
        const counters = await db.select()
            .from(countersTable)
            .where(eq(countersTable.id, 1))
            .execute();
        
        expect(counters).toHaveLength(1);
        expect(counters[0].count).toBe(11);
        expect(counters[0].updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    });

    it('should generate different messages for different count milestones', async () => {
        // Test various count milestones
        const testCases = [
            { count: 0, expectedMessage: "🎯 Ready to start counting? Let's go! 🚀" },
            { count: 1, expectedMessage: "🎉 First click! You're on your way! ✨" },
            { count: 3, expectedMessage: "🌟 You've clicked 4 times! Keep going! 💪" },
            { count: 7, expectedMessage: "🔥 8 clicks and counting! You're on fire! 🚀" },
            { count: 15, expectedMessage: "🎊 Wow! 16 clicks! You're unstoppable! 💫" },
            { count: 35, expectedMessage: "🏆 Amazing! 36 clicks! You're a clicking champion! 🎯" },
            { count: 75, expectedMessage: "🚀 Incredible! 76 clicks! You're reaching for the stars! ⭐" },
            { count: 250, expectedMessage: "🎉 Phenomenal! 251 clicks! You're a clicking legend! 👑" },
            { count: 750, expectedMessage: "💎 Outstanding! 751 clicks! You're absolutely brilliant! ✨" },
            { count: 1500, expectedMessage: "🌟 LEGENDARY! 1501 clicks! You've achieved greatness! 🏆👑🎊" }
        ];

        for (const testCase of testCases) {
            // Create counter with specific count
            await db.insert(countersTable)
                .values({ id: testCase.count + 100, count: testCase.count }) // Use unique IDs
                .execute();
            
            const input: IncrementCounterInput = { id: testCase.count + 100 };
            const result = await incrementCounter(input);
            
            expect(result.message).toBe(testCase.expectedMessage);
            expect(result.count).toBe(testCase.count + 1);
        }
    });

    it('should handle multiple different counters', async () => {
        // Create two different counters
        await db.insert(countersTable)
            .values([
                { id: 2, count: 5 },
                { id: 3, count: 10 }
            ])
            .execute();
        
        // Increment first counter
        const result1 = await incrementCounter({ id: 2 });
        expect(result1.id).toBe(2);
        expect(result1.count).toBe(6);
        
        // Increment second counter
        const result2 = await incrementCounter({ id: 3 });
        expect(result2.id).toBe(3);
        expect(result2.count).toBe(11);
        
        // Verify both counters are separate in database
        const counters = await db.select()
            .from(countersTable)
            .execute();
        
        expect(counters).toHaveLength(2);
        const counter2 = counters.find(c => c.id === 2);
        const counter3 = counters.find(c => c.id === 3);
        
        expect(counter2?.count).toBe(6);
        expect(counter3?.count).toBe(11);
    });
});
